name: Seo Jin Park
content: Seo Jin Park | Homepage Homepage I am hiring 1 postdoc and 3+ new PhDs this season. Learn more [here] For undergrads in other schools, there’s a paid summer internship opportunity. [here] About me I am co-leading USC Networked Systems Lab. I am an Assistant Professor at USC Computer Science Department since 2023 Fall. Before joining USC, I spent a year at Google Systems Research Group. I did my postdoc at MIT CSAIL with Prof. Mohammad Alizadeh and Prof. Adam Belay. I received a Ph.D. in Computer Science from Stanford University in 2019, where I was advised by Prof. John Ousterhout. For my PhD study, I was supported by Samsung Scholarship (2013-2018). I received a B.S. in Computer Science and in Mathematics, and a M.Eng in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from MIT in 2013. What’s New [Mar 2025] “Granular Resource Demand Heterogeneity” is accepted to HotOS'25 [Oct 2024] Received an award from USC+Amazon Center Link [Sep 2024] Received gift funding from Google [Jul 2024] “Quicksand: Harnessing Stranded Datacenter Resources with Granular Computing” is accepted to NSDI'25 [Jun 2024] Received gift funding from Cisco Systems [Jun 2024] Invited to NSF Ideas Lab Breaking the Low Latency Barrier for Verticals in Next-G Wireless Networks [Jun 2024] “Lovelock: Towards Smart NIC-hosted Clusters” is accepted to HotCarbon'25 [Apr 2024] Servering in PC for ASPLOS'25 and NSDI'25
